channel.title: BALTIC Bites
channel.description: BALTIC Bites is a freely available, ongoing series of video podcasts which visually explore BALTIC exhibitions and projects in bitesize form and includes footage of artwork, curators, artists and gallery visitors. Also available, BALTIC Soundbites, our ongoing series of audio podcasts. Both BALTIC Bites and BALTIC Soundbites have exclusive content and compliment each other in bringing you a broad insight into BALTIC. They are both available free of charge and once downloaded can be played on any supporting portable device or on your computer. Visit www.balticmill.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: Video Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: BALTIC Bites is a freely available, ongoing series of video podcasts which visually explore BALTIC exhibitions and projects in bitesize form and includes footage of artwork, curators, artists and gallery visitors. Also available, BALTIC Soundbites, our ongoing series of audio podcasts. Both BALTIC Bites and BALTIC Soundbites have exclusive content and compliment each other in bringing you a broad insight into BALTIC. They are both available free of charge and once downloaded can be played on any supporting portable device or on your computer. Visit www.balticmill.com
channel.itunes:author: BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art
channel.itunes:keywords: baltic, bites, bytes, podcast, video, art, contemporary, gallery, museum, artist, talks, exhibitions

item.title: BALTIC BItes - Phyllida Barlow on SWITCH
item.description: Phyllida Barlow discusses her selection for SWITCH, the inaugural exhibition at BALTIC 39.

item.title: BALTIC Bites - Turner Prize 2011: Hilary Lloyd
item.description: Turner Prize 2011: HILARY LLOYD who combines still and moving images, sound and the three dimensional forms of AV playback equipment to portray the urban environment.
item.itunes:author: BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art
item.itunes:summary: Turner Prize 2011: HILARY LLOYD who combines still and moving images, sound and the three dimensional forms of AV playback equipment to portray the urban environment.
item.itunes:subtitle: Turner Prize 2011: HILARY LLOYD who combines still and moving images, sound and the three dimensional forms of AV playback equipment to portray the urban environment.

item.title: BALTIC Bites - Turner Prize 2011: Martin Boyce
item.description: Turner Prize 2011: MARTIN BOYCE who holds the viewer with atmospheric sculptural installations, combining references to design history and text, marked by a subtle attention to detail.
item.itunes:author: BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art
item.itunes:summary: Turner Prize 2011: MARTIN BOYCE who holds the viewer with atmospheric sculptural installations, combining references to design history and text, marked by a subtle attention to detail.
item.itunes:subtitle: Turner Prize 2011: MARTIN BOYCE who holds the viewer with atmospheric sculptural installations, combining references to design history and text, marked by a subtle attention to detail.

item.title: BALTIC Bites - Turner Prize 2011: Karla Black
item.description: Turner Prize 2011: KARLA BLACK who has an innovative approach to sculpture and makes substantial works made in otherwise temporary spaces and materials.
item.itunes:author: BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art
item.itunes:summary: Turner Prize 2011: KARLA BLACK who has an innovative approach to sculpture and makes substantial works made in otherwise temporary spaces and materials.
item.itunes:subtitle: Turner Prize 2011: KARLA BLACK who has an innovative approach to sculpture and makes substantial works made in otherwise temporary spaces and materials.

item.title: BALTIC Bites - Turner Prize 2011, George Shaw
item.description: Turner Prize 2011: GEORGE SHAW whose paintings, with their deeply personal juxtaposition of subject matter and material, lie intriguingly on the edge of tradition.
item.itunes:author: BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art
item.itunes:summary: Turner Prize 2011: GEORGE SHAW whose paintings, with their deeply personal juxtaposition of subject matter and material, lie intriguingly on the edge of tradition.
